list_page_teaser: I often get my friends to answer the questionnaire so I can learn more about them and draw their image.  View this gallery to see the resultant images, and learn about them as well.
description_html:
These are some images of my friends, from when I wrote the original version when I was in grad school.

These are images of real live normal people, whom I have known for many years!
story_html: See if you can match the people in the photo above with their spiritual portraits below!

image_list.title: Eric Erickson
image_list.subtitle_html: Party Friend from Back in the Day
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Eric was a good friend of mine in Richmond.  He passed away recently.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Eric's dominant trait, his pragmatism.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Eric's auxiliary trait, his rationality.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.
image_list.story_intro_html: Eric was an out-going, open-minded, and cheerful friend. He loved music and we had many good times, going to concerts, hanging out down by the river, always ....
image_list.story_html:
Eric was an out-going, open-minded, cheerful friend. He loved music and we had many good times, going to concerts, hanging out down by the river, always drinking and smoking.

When punk rock came along he was — unlike some of my friends — open to the newer sounds. Ultimately, though, Cat Stevens was his favorite artist.

He had a great laugh and was hard-working and smart, but after completing high school, had no interest in furthering his education. As we grew older and less resilient to the after effects of partying, most of us learned how to abstain or at least moderate. Eric was one exception to this general trend I saw among my friends and in myself, as we grew into our thirties and beyond.

At one point he read some Nietzsche. This seemed to fuel his drinking and make him more apathetic about life in general and the future in particular. Ultimately he became a very tragic figure.

Eric passed away on November 26, 2016. His spirit was as unique as this portrait of it, and I am glad to have this image of his personality to remember him by.

image_list.title: Bob N.
image_list.subtitle_html: Expert at Buying Stones Tickets
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Bob and I have been to see many concerts together.  We have even seen the Rolling Stones a few times!  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Bob's dominant trait, his rationality.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Bob's auxiliary trait, his pragmatism.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.
image_list.story_intro_html: Bob lives in Powhatan, Virginia. He went to school at ....
image_list.story_html:
Bob lives in Powhatan, Virginia. He went to school at University of Colorado in Boulder.

I will share more information as it becomes available.

image_list.title: BJ N.
image_list.subtitle_html: Music Lover and Musician
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: BJ's spiritual portrait shows he is the opposite type of his father Bob N.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents BJ's dominant trait, his passion.  In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  He demonstrates this trait in his passion for music.
image_list.explain_aux: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents BJ's auxiliary trait, his openness to ideas.  In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.
image_list.story_intro_html: BJ lives in Midlothian, Virginia. His father, Bob N., encouraged him to listen to and appreciate music, and ultim....
image_list.story_html:
BJ lives in Midlothian, Virginia. His father, Bob N., encouraged him to listen to and appreciate music, and ultimately BJ chose a career as a musician.

I will share more information as it becomes available.

image_list.title: Dave G.
image_list.subtitle_html: Self-employed Environmental Chemist
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Dave and I went to Graduate School together (but in different programs).  He helped me get my start in Colorado, but now lives in Hawaii.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Dave's dominant trait, his idealism.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  As this image shows, Dave is very idealistic.  I recently asked him how he felt about Bernie Sanders, and he said Bernie is ok, but still not 'pure on everything.'
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Dave's auxiliary trait, his passion.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.
image_list.story_intro_html: Dave lives in Kilauea, Hawaii. He went to undergraduate school at University of Colorado in Boulder and graduate school at ....
image_list.story_html:
Dave lives in Kilauea, Hawaii. He went to undergraduate school at University of Colorado in Boulder and graduate school at Virginia Commonwealth University. He now works as a self-employed Environmental Chemist.

I will share more information as it becomes available.

image_list.title: Greg L.
image_list.subtitle_html: Self-employed Independent Consultant
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Greg and I have been friends for many years.  He used to be 'famous' for having annual Snakebite Parties!  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Greg's dominant trait, his rationality.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Greg's auxiliary trait, his pragmatism.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.
image_list.story_intro_html: Greg lives in Richmond, Virginia. He has a BS in Information Systems from Virginia Commonwealth University and is now ....
image_list.story_html:
Greg lives in Richmond, Virginia. He has a BS in Information Systems from Virginia Commonwealth University and is now a self-employed independent consultant.

I will share more information as it becomes available.

image_list.title: Roy B. Scherer
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Roy Scherer is a friend I met through some of my Libertarian friends when I lived in Richmond, Virginia.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in Roy's spiritual portrait represents his pragmatism.  In Extraverts, the dominant function is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this.
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in Roy's spiritual portrait represents his preference for making logical decisions.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary function is directed inwardly and is less evident than the dominant function.
image_list.story_intro_html: When I wrote the original version of the Groja © Program in college in Richmond, Virginia, I was very interested in Libertarianism. During that time ....
image_list.story_html:
When I wrote the original version of the Groja © Program in college in Richmond, Virginia, I was very interested in Libertarianism. During that time I was able to get Roy B. Scherer to answer the questions in the Keirsey Temperament Sorter. Roy is still a Libertarian who continues to lobby in Richmond Virginia for gun rights and the legalization of marijuana.

Here is an image of his personality. One might think that marijuana legalization would be a passionate issue, but his portrait shows that, for him at least, it was largely a matter of logic.
